Header: Signs of Chandrika’s SLFP membership getting suspended
Content: The general secretary of the SLFP parliamentarian Dayasiri Jayasekera says that steps will be taken to suspend the party membership of a group including former president Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunge for supporting presidential candidate Sajith Premadasa against the party’s decision. The parliamentarian further noted that the final decision in this regard will be arrived at the SLFP central working committee meeting on Tuesday afternoon. Several parties including the former president signed an MOU with presidential candidate Sajith Premadasa yesterday in order to create the United National Front. The general secretary of SLFP Dayasiri Jayasekera said that this is the third occasion in which the former president has divided the party. Meanwhile a speaker of the Sri Lanka Nidahas Podujana Sandanaya which was created recently said that the office bearers for the alliance will be elected subsequent to the presidential election. It has been reported that both sectors have agreed to appoint president Maithripala Sirisena and opposition leader Mahinda Rajapaksa as the co-chairmans of the alliance. It has been further reported that the post of general secretary will be held by the SLPP while SLFP will hold the posts of deputy general secretary and national organizer.
